caseTitle: YAW AGYEI, AGNES KORANKYE, RITA GYAMFUWAA, FRED ANSONG DWAMENA VRS. MIKE SIMILAO
summary: The plaintiffs initiated proceedings at the High Court, Accra, and filed an application for an interlocutory injunction on 12th July 2007, scheduled for hearing on 30th July 2007. The defendant entered a conditional appearance and opposed the application, tendering exhibits. The application was adjourned to 1st November 2007, when it was dismissed by Dzakpasu J. The plaintiffs appealed to the Court of Appeal, which dismissed their appeal. The case was further appealed to the Supreme Court, where the panel led by Atuguba JSC heard the matter. The judgment was delivered by Ansa JSC, though the full reasoning and final decision are not fully visible due to document truncation.
verdict: The Court of Appeal dismissed the plaintiffs' appeal; the Supreme Court's final decision is not fully ascertainable from the truncated document.
citations: SUPREME COURT/2011/YAW AGYEI, AGNES KORANKYE, RITA GYAMFUWAA, FRED ANSONG DWAMENA VRS. MIKE SIMILAO
rationaleHighlights: Application for interlocutory injunction was adjourned and later dismissed by Dzakpasu J.
Plaintiffs appealed to the Court of Appeal, which dismissed the appeal.
Matter appears to have been further appealed to the Supreme Court, though final determination is not visible in the truncated text.
Procedural history indicates focus on pre-trial relief and appellate review.
confidenceNotes: The document appears to be truncated; analysis is based on available text. Full context of arguments and final judgment may be missing.
